title: World Autism Awareness Day, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump declaring April 2, 2025, as World Autism Awareness Day. It recognizes the challenges faced by the millions of Americans living with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and emphasizes the importance of early detection and intervention for improving their quality of life. The proclamation highlights the increase in autism prevalence, now affecting 1 in 36 children, compared to 1 in 10,000 in the 1980s. 

The President expresses gratitude to families and communities supporting individuals with ASD and outlines his administration's commitment to researching the root causes of health issues, particularly childhood disorders like autism. He encourages Americans to learn about autism signs to improve early diagnosis and support for affected individuals and their families. The proclamation reinforces the notion that people with ASD contribute significantly to society and calls for collective efforts to empower them to achieve their potential.
